definition: to take turns on duty
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: Teacher will lead the daily duty group to prepare the meals for the camp.
sentences.chinese: 吃饭前由生活组辅导老师带领轮值营友为全体备餐。

sentences.english: I go here an hour ago, I have been in the library researching clerking spell.
sentences.chinese: 我一小时来到这，看一下图书馆职员轮值时间。

sentences.english: An EU comprises a headquarters element and four platoons which operate on a three-shift basis.
sentences.chinese: 冲锋队设有一个总部和四支分三班轮值的小队。

sentences.english: Indonesia is the largest country in ASEAN and is ASEAN's rotating presidency this year.
sentences.chinese: 印尼是东盟最大的国家，今年担任东盟轮值主席国。

sentences.english: In January Ireland takes over the six-monthly presidency of the EU.
sentences.chinese: 从一月开始，爱尔兰接任为期半年的欧盟轮值主席国。

sentences.english: Finland is the current president of the 25-member European Union.
sentences.chinese: 芬兰是有25个成员的欧盟的轮值主席国。

sentences.english: France holds the G8 and G20 presidencies this year.
sentences.chinese: 法国是今年八国集团和20国集团的轮值主席。

definition: (of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
shift working
on night duty
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to assign (a task to different people)/to allocate
to discuss official business
unified administration
morning roll call
paraphernalia of a guard of honor
to perform one's job/attendant/job/duties/(respectful appellation for the addressee) you/your Excellency/(Church) deacon
to be on all-night duty/to be on night watch/to keep a vigil
on night duty
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to supervise/to control
regular meeting
to convene/to gather
